title: Portugal announces the expulsion of 18,000 foreigners ahead of a national election
Beloved Motorcycle Company Announces Bad News as Sales Plunge
Australia PM Albanese makes stunning comeback with landslide win
description: Donald Trump loomed large over the election, with comparisons drawn between the US president and defeated opposition leader Peter Dutton.

title: Warren Buffett, 94, stepping down as Berkshire Hathaway CEO
description: The veteran investor known as the Sage of Omaha told his company's annual meeting that he would hand over the reins to Vice-Chairman Greg Abel.

title: End of an era: Warren Buffett will ask Berkshire board to replace him as CEO with Greg Abel
description: Buffett said he will still 'hang around' to help, but the final word on company operations and capital deployment would be with Abel, 62.

title: Greg Abel is the successor to Warren Buffett at Berkshire Hathaway. Here's how he got there
description: Warren Buffett's successor is expected to officially be the new Berkshire Hathaway CEO at the end of this year.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Druse in Syrian Town Rocked by Violence Agree to Disarm Militias
description: After this week’s bloodshed, Druse leaders in Ashrafieh Sahnaya agreed to integrate militia fighters into government forces. But some residents remain wary.
author: Vivian Yee, Hwaida Saad and Nanna Heitmann

title: These Contentious Issues Could Determine Who Becomes the Next Pope
description: As cardinals gather to elect Pope Francis’ successor, they are facing debates over whether the church most needs change or constancy.
author: Motoko Rich

title: Lawrence Wong's Party Secures Landslide Victory In Singapore General Election
description: Prime Minister Lawrence Wong's People's Action Party (PAP) won the Singapore General Election Saturday by a landslide, securing 87 of the 97 parliamentary seats, local media reported.

title: "Trade Should Not Be A Weapon": Warren Buffett Amid Trump's Tariff War
description: Influential billionaire investor Warren Buffett said Saturday that "trade should not be a weapon," in remarks clearly targeting US President Donald Trump's aggressive use of tariffs against countries around the world.

description: First Canada, Now Australia: The Trump Factor Boosts Another World Leader in an Election  WSJ'Trump was the game-changer': Three things to know about the Australian election result  BBCAustralia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese heads to a second 3-year term  NPRAustralia’s center-left Labor Party retains power in vote seen as test of anti-Trump sentiment  CNNThe Australian PM’s experience showed but a truly terrible Trump-inspired Coalition election campaign helped  The Guardian

title: Trump’s ‘catch and revoke’ rule: One strike could cost foreign students their visas
author: TOI World Desk

title: Albanese rides anti-Trump wave; 1st Australian PM in 21 years to win 2 elections
Ugandan ​​activist​ asks HSBC to put ‘lives before profit’ as campaigners target bank’s AGM
description: Patience Nabukalu, who has experienced climate-related flooding, joins protestors from around the world to deliver a letter to CEO Georges Elhedery criticising the financing of oil, gas and coal projectsAt nine years old, Patience Nabukalu was devastated when her friend, Kevin, died in severe flooding that hit their Kampala suburb, Nateete, a former wetland. Witnessing deaths and the destruction of homes and livelihoods in floods made worse by extreme rainfall has had a profound impact on her.She decided to try to bring about change – to do what she could to amplify the voices of those in the Ugandan communities worst affected by the climate crisis. Continue reading...
author: Karen McVeigh

title: Ugandan opposition accuses president of using military courts to quash dissent
description: Politicians say Yoweri Museveni is prosecuting opponents on politically motivated charges before 2026 electionUgandan opposition politicians have accused the president, Yoweri Museveni, of attempting to quash dissent by prosecuting opponents on politically motivated charges in military courts in the run-up to presidential and legislative elections next year.The government is pushing to introduce a law to allow military tribunals to try civilians despite a supreme court ban on the practice. Continue reading...
author: Carlos Mureithi in Kampala

title: Australia’s Labor Party, buoyed by anti-Trump bump, wins landslide reelection
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese made a major comeback after trailing in polls, while conservative leader Peter Dutton, hurt by Trumpian tendencies, lost his seat.
author: Michael E. Miller

title: Before a new pope, a tug-of-war for the soul of the Catholic Church
description: As cardinals prepare for the largest papal conclave in history, battle lines are being drawn over the direction of the church.
author: Anthony Faiola, Michelle Boorstein
